page.title: 06 Leon Garfield's Visit
page.content: Leon Garfield the famous author of childrens books such as 'Jack Holborn' visited our school on the 7th of May 1985.The visit had been arranged by the local members of the Federation of Childrens Book Group.They are trying to encourage children to read more and they thought a way of doing this would be to have the children meet a well known author. When Mr Garfield arrived he was shown into the hall where we waited impatiently.I could only see the top of his head because I was sitting at the back.When I stood up to ask a question I was surprised at his appearence.He wore a purple shirt a green suit and a red and white bow tie He comes from London and at first we found his accent difficult to understand but he answered all our questions.I really enjoyed it.
